you messed up your permissions on /etc

setting all to root:root 755/644, /etc/sudoers to 440
nope
the kernel doesn't install because the postrm failes (because you stupidly chmodded all 777)
repair permissions and it should install (if you don't know how, reinstallation could be easier)
I'd like to try repair. And I don't remember why I did that :P Anyway, where do I find the repair option in the live cd?
there is no repair-option, its done by hand. mount your /-fs and try to fix
chmod/chown are the commands you'll need
